title: Join our Talent Pool-Customer Care Specialist (Americas)
description:
ðŸ§˜ What we offer

  • Fully remote work environment â€“ work from anywhere globally
  • A part-time opportunity for a long-term contract (up to 25 hours per week but may vary depending on scheduling needs)
  • Compensated time off each year
As your journey continues with us, after six months, you can also benefit from a personal development budget and office stipend. In addition, if you join our team for more than 30 hours per week, you will get health and travel insurance.


ðŸš€ We look forward to hearing from you!
SafetyWing (YC W18) is looking to connect with talented Customer Care Specialists who share our mission and are eager to make a meaningful impact on the future of work. By applying now, youâ€™ll be among the first to hear about and explore new roles as they open.

While we are headquartered in San Francisco, our international team is fully distributed, stretching ten time zones. We are on a mission to remove the role of geographical borders as a barrier to equal opportunities and freedom for everyone. And we are doing that by creating simple health insurance and retirement products for remote workers worldwide as a replacement for national welfare systems. Currently, we support two main products: Travel Medical Insurance and Health Insurance (for companies and individuals).

We provide 24/7 support to our members and work with a â€˜follow the sunâ€™ model. That means we donâ€™t do night shifts or very early mornings. While we work remotely, we have a friendly and helpful global team, and weâ€™re  looking for someone who is a joy to work with.  

Below are some of the principles we live by:
  • Be honest
  • Help the customer
  • Be clear and concise
  • Be kind and make the customer happy

ðŸ’» Your responsibilities will include

  • Answer customer questions via live chat, email, and phone support.
  • Proactively look at how to improve the customer experience.

Our top priority is to help our customers find solutions that help them get what they want and need. Within the boundaries of honesty and effective communication, we aim to have conversations that make our customers not only happy supporters of SafetyWing but happy in general.

ðŸ§ª We are looking for someone who

  • Has excellent English language skills (written and spoken).
  • Has the ability to work independently and be a problem-solver.
  • Is comfortable working on weekends (usual shifts are between 4 and 8 hours long) and available for up to 25 hours a week.
  • Extra shine if you have experience with insurance, customer service, or healthcare.
  • Is comfortable working within the Americas zones.
ðŸ˜€ We like to work with people who
  • Want to help build a global social safety net on the Internet.
  • Think for themselves instead of copying others.
  • Are willing to try new things, even with the risk of failure.
  • Are intellectually curious and open to new ideas.
  • Are creative and bold in the face of any problems.
  • Have strong integrity and do the right thing.

title: Enterprise Sales Director
Strategic Enterprise Sales Director
Analytics Engineer
Android Engineer
Senior Technical Product Designer
description:
Overview

Since founding Coalesce, our mission has remained the same: to improve the lives of data professionals by helping them transform data as efficiently as possible. We aim to bring an end to the days of arduous manual coding and inflexible GUIs by providing a best of both worlds solution.

Weâ€™re seeking a Senior Technical Product Designer to join our innovative team and drive the design of sophisticated, highly technical SaaS products. In this pivotal role, you'll collaborate directly with our product and engineering teams, defining and shaping products that address complex customer needs while setting a benchmark for usability and excellence. This role is ideal for someone passionate about working in a fast-paced startup environment, eager to lead design initiatives, and motivated by the opportunity to significantly influence Coalesce's growth and direction.

About the Role

The design team at Coalesce is organized around two core product areas: Transformation (where this role is focused) and Data Catalog. While the teams work on distinct domains, we operate as one cohesive design team. We work closely across product lines â€” through regular design critiques, brainstorming sessions, and shared ideation â€” to ensure a unified user experience and consistent design language across the platform.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who will complement the teamâ€™s strengths with strong craft, systems thinking, and execution skills. The ideal candidate is not only highly autonomous and collaborative, but also curious and forward-thinking â€” especially when it comes to AI. Weâ€™re particularly excited to meet designers who are already exploring or integrating AI tools in their design process, and who are eager to help us shape how AI can enhance our product and our practice.

As part of the role, youâ€™ll also get access to premium tools to support your work and creativity, including Nicelydone, ChatGPT, and other AI and research tools we regularly use across the team for ideation and productivity.

What you will be doing

  • Lead end-to-end design processes, creating intuitive and visually compelling user interfaces, user flows, and interactive prototypes.

  • Take ownership of new features, from initial research and concept through design and user validation.

  • Conduct targeted user research and usability testing to deeply understand customer and stakeholder needs, informing design decisions.

  • Work closely with product managers to define product requirements and translate them into actionable design solutions.

  • Engage actively with engineering teams, ensuring feasibility and high-quality execution of designs.

  • Continuously enhance our existing product by identifying areas for improvement and proposing innovative solutions.

  • Advocate for and help evolve design guidelines, standards, and best practices across the organization.

  • Manage relationships and drive alignment with internal stakeholders.

  • Collaborate effectively with distributed teams across multiple time zones, including North America, Europe and New Zealand.

  • Drive non-feature related design projects, such as ensuring the seamless integration of multiple products' look and feel.

What we are looking for

  • Minimum 6 years of proven experience as a Product Designer, preferably with experience designing complex, technical SaaS products.

  • Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve challenging design problems and translate complex concepts into elegant, intuitive solutions. Reduce the scope, complexity, and ambiguity of projects to a more manageable state.

  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong proficiency in Figma and familiarity with other design and prototyping tools.

  • Experience working with design component libraries, knowing when to leverage existing components or create new ones.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; adept at collaborating effectively with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders. Participate inÂ design reviews, exchanging feedback appropriately.

  • Strong stakeholder management skills.

  • Proven experience working within Agile/Scrum methodologies in cross-functional teams.

  • A proactive, independent worker capable of managing priorities effectively in a remote, dynamic startup environment.

  • Familiarity with accessibility best practices and WCAG guidelines.

Bonus Qualifications

  • Solid understanding of data management concepts, data warehousing, or related technical domains.

Since founding Coalesce in 2020, our mission has remained the same: to improve the lives of data professionals by helping them transform data as efficiently as possible. We aim to bring an end to the days of arduous manual coding and inflexible GUIs by providing a best of both worlds solution.Â 

Coalesce is a fully remote and culture-first company. We believe that our culture is what allows us to not only recruit world-class talent, but also retain it. At Coalesce, you can expect to experience radical honesty, trust in the workplace empathy for yourself and others, and support for continuous learning and improvement.

US Benefits: Coalesce offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical insurance; Dental insurance; Vision insurance; Life, AD&D, and Disability Insurance; Unlimited Paid Time off, Paid Sick Time, Equity, Internet Reimbursement, WFH Office Set-Up Reimbursement, 401(k) retirement plan, and Company Annual Leave between December 26- January 2.Â

title: Senior Systems Engineer (worldwide remote, work anywhere)
description:
CloudLinux is looking for a System Engineer to join our Infrastructure team - the engine that powers our companyâ€™s internal systems and services. Our team manages everything from secure access and compute resources to building and maintaining our internal tooling and infrastructure automations.

If youâ€™re passionate about Linux, infrastructure, and automation, and love solving complex problems that make life easier for others, we want to hear from you.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

â€¢ Server Lifecycle Management: Deploy and maintain production systems across bare-metal servers, private clouds, and public cloud platforms.

â€¢ Infrastructure as Code: Use tools like Terraform to manage infrastructure in a scalable, repeatable way.

â€¢ Domain & DNS Management: Manage DNS records, domains, and related configurations.

â€¢ Security & Updates: Configure firewalls, ensure regular OS updates, and support internal security initiatives.

â€¢ Monitoring & Incident Response: Proactively monitor systems and resolve incidents to ensure uptime and performance.

â€¢ Service Development: Build and integrate internal services based on requirements from development teams.

â€¢ CI/CD Automation: Design and maintain GitLab pipelines and automation for infrastructure and administrative tasks.

â€¢ Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation for infrastructure, services, and procedures.

â€¢ Projects: Develop and support the companyâ€™s projects infrastructure.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience:

â€¢ Strong knowledge of Linux systems (preferably RHEL, CentOS, or AlmaLinux)

â€¢ Solid understanding of network fundamentals

â€¢ Proven experience with Ansible and other configuration management tools

â€¢ Hands-on experience with Terraform / Terragrunt

â€¢ Cloud experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure

â€¢ Familiarity with on-premise data centers, bare-metal servers, CEPH, Junipers

â€¢ Experience with virtualization and cloud management platforms such as VMware, OpenNebula, oVirt, or OpenStack

â€¢ Experience with FreeIPA for identity and access management

â€¢ Experience with Foreman for provisioning and lifecycle management

â€¢ Familiarity with GitLab and CI/CD pipelines

â€¢ Good scripting skills in Bash and/or Python

â€¢ B2 English (both written and spoken) and excellent documentation skills

â€¢ Ability to learn independently and troubleshoot complex problems

Benefits

What's in it for you?

  • A focus on professional development.
  • Interesting and challenging projects.
  • Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide.
  • Paid 24 days of vacation per year, 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves.
  • Compensation for private medical insurance.
  • Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement.
  • Budget for education.
  • The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data as described in our Privacy Policy (https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-privacy-notice), which provides detailed information on how we maintain and handle your data.
